name: UIDragger
comment: [Experimental] A draggable UI that provides handler such as [`UIDragger.onDrag`](#link) and [`UIDragger.onDrop`](#link).

signatures.comment: Create a dragger which has all the states in UIButton, with additional "dragging" (a boolean indicating whether it's currently being dragged) and "offset" (a Pt representing the offset between this UI's position and the pointer's position when dragged) states. (See [`UI.state`](#link)) You may also create a new UIDragger using one of the static helper like [`UI.fromRectangle`](#link) or [`UI.fromCircle`](#link).

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a Group that defines the UI's appearance

parameters.name: shape
parameters.comment: specifies the shape of the Group

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: Optional default state object

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: Optional id string

accessors.name: group
accessors.comment: A group of Pts that defines this UI's shape.

accessors.name: id
accessors.comment: An unique id of the UI.

accessors.name: shape
accessors.comment: A string that describes this UI's shape.

signatures.comment: Continue to keep track of an actions even if it's not within this UI. Useful for hover-leave and drag-outside.

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: a string defined in [`UIPointerActions`](#link)

signatures.comment: Listen for UI events and trigger action handlers.

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: an action key. Can be one of UIPointerActions or a custom one.

parameters.name: p
parameters.comment: a point to check

signatures.comment: Remove an event handler.

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: event key

parameters.name: which
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UI.on`](#link). If this is not defined, all handlers in this key will be removed.

signatures.comment: Remove an existing click handler
signatures.returns_comment: a boolean indicating whether the handler was removed successfully

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UIButton.onClick`](#link). If this is not defined, all handlers in this key will be removed.

signatures.comment: Remove an existing drag handler
signatures.returns_comment: a boolean indicating whether the handler was removed successfully

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UIDragger.onDrag`](#link). If this is not defined, all handlers in this key will be removed.

signatures.comment: Remove an existing drop handler
signatures.returns_comment: a boolean indicating whether the handler was removed successfully

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UIDragger.onDrag`](#link). If this is not defined, all handlers in this key will be removed.

signatures.comment: Remove handlers for hover events.
signatures.returns_comment: an array of booleans indicating whether the handlers were removed successfully

parameters.name: enterID
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UI.onClick`](#link), or -1 to skip. If this is not defined, all handlers in this key will be removed.

parameters.name: leaveID
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UI.onClick`](#link), or -1 to skip. If this is not defined, all handlers in this key will be removed.

signatures.comment: Add an event handler. Remember this UI will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`.
signatures.returns_comment: an id number that reference to this handler, for use in [`UI.off`](#link)

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: event key

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a [`UIHandler`](#link) callback function: `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string )`

signatures.comment: Add a new click handler. Remember this button will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`.
signatures.returns_comment: an id number that refers to this handler, for use in [`UIButton.offClick`](#link) or [`UI.off`](#link).

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a [`UIHandler`](#link) callback function: `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string )`

signatures.comment: Add a new drag handler. Remember this button will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`.
signatures.returns_comment: an id number that refers to this handler, for use in [`UIDragger.offDrag`](#link) or [`UI.off`](#link).

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a [`UIHandler`](#link) callback function: `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string )`. You can access the states "dragging" and "offset" (See [`UI.state`](#link)) in the callback.

signatures.comment: Add a new drop handler. Remember this button will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`.
signatures.returns_comment: an id number that refers to this handler, for use in [`UIDragger.offDrop`](#link) or [`UI.off`](#link).

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a [`UIHandler`](#link) callback function: `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string )`

signatures.comment: Add handlers for hover events. Remember this button will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`.
signatures.returns_comment: id numbers that refer to enter/leave handlers, for use in [`UIButton.offHover`](#link) or [`UI.off`](#link).

parameters.name: enter
parameters.comment: an optional [`UIHandler`](#link) function to handle when pointer enters hover. Eg, `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string )`

parameters.name: leave
parameters.comment: an optional [`UIHandler`](#link) function to handle when pointer exits hover. Eg, `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string )`

signatures.comment: Take a custom render function to render this UI.

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a render function

signatures.comment: Get and/or set a specific UI state.

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: state's name

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment: optionally set a new value for this state.key

signatures.comment: Returns a string representation of this UI
Stop keeping track of this action

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: an id returned by the [`UI.hold`](#link) function

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a Circle UI.

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a group that defines a rectangle

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: optional id string

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a Polygon UI.

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a group that defines a rectangle

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: optional id string

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a Rectangle UI.

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a group that defines a rectangle

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: optional id string

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a new UI based on another UI.

parameters.name: ui
parameters.comment: base UI

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

signatures.comment: A static function to listen for a list of UIs. See also [`UI.listen`](#link).

parameters.name: uis
parameters.comment: an array of UI

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: an action key. Can be one of `UIPointerActions` or a custom one.

parameters.name: p
parameters.comment: A point to check
